member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.AttributeCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of Attributes attached to a ProjectObject. Attributes are stored as a key/value pair. Keys can be assoicated with a Guid. A key with a Guid can only be removed by a client that knows the Guid.
member.remarks: Add-Ins should consider associating attribute keys with a Guid to make sure that the attribute is not removed by accident by another Add-In. To avoid conflicts with attribute keys defined by RobotStudio or other Add-Ins, prefix the key with the Add-In name.

member.value: The item at the specified key.

member.summary: Gets the item at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the item to get.
member.exception: The index value is greater than the number of items in the collection.
member.value: The item at the specified index.

member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the .

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.AttributeCollection.Add(System.Guid,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a protected attribute to this AttributeCollection object. A protected attribute can only be modified or removed if the access id used when creating it is known.
member.param: The access id.
The key to be added.
The value to be associated with key. The following types are allowed: , , , , ,
member.exception: The key is protected by an access id.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.AttributeCollection.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Add an attribute to this AttributeCollection object.
member.param: The key to be added.
The value to be associated with key, see remarks.
member.exception: The key is protected by a access id.
The value type is not supported.
An array may not contain values ​​of null.
member.remarks: Add-Ins should prefix attribute keys with the Add-In name to avoid conflicts with other Add-Ins. For example the Add-In "CompanyABCAddIn" that stores a lenght value as an attribute could use a key named "CompanyABCAdd.Length". The following types are allowed for the value argument and arrays of these types: , , , , , , , , , The matrix must be rigid.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.Deactivate
member.summary: Deactivates the PowerPac and updates RobotStudios internal state about which PowerPac is active. This method is typically called by RobotStudio, but might also be called by the PowerPac.
member.remarks: If the PowerPac is not already deactivated, OnDeactivate is called.
member.returns: True if OnDeactivate returns true or already deactivated. False if OnDeactivate returns false.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.OnActivate
member.summary: Called when the user has told RobotStudio to activate your PowerPac.
member.returns: True if you have activated the PowerPac, false if you could not activate.
member.remarks: Add the user interface elements needed for the PowerPac.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.OnDeactivate
member.summary: Called when the user has told RobotStudio to deactivate your PowerPac.
member.returns: True if you have deactivated the PowerPac, false if not. For example you might want to prevent deactivation if there is unsaved data.
member.remarks: Remove or hide(?) the user interface elements added in OnActivate. RobotStudio will make visible all its RibbonTabs automatically.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.CanActivate(System.String@)
member.summary: Called by RobotStudio user interface code, to let you tell the user if your PowerPac can be activated or not.
member.param: If you return false, then specify a reason using this paramter.
member.returns: True if the PowerPac can be activated, false if not.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.CanDeactivate(System.String@)
member.summary: Called by RobotStudio user interface code, to let you tell the user if your PowerPac can be deactivated or not.
member.param: If you return false, then specify a reason using this paramter.
member.returns: True if the PowerPac can be activated, false if not.
member.remarks: The default implementation always returns true, which should be sufficient for most PowerPacs. This method will be called frequently. Only return false if your in the middle of along running operation that cannot easily be interrupted.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.OnLoad
member.summary: Called when the PowerPac DLL is first loaded into memory by RobotStudio.
member.remarks: Override this method only if you need to do initialization code that should only be called once in the life time of the PowerPac. Do not add user interface here.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Options
member.summary: Provides static methods, properties and events to store and read user options. Options are grouped in sections.
member.remarks: Options created by Add-Ins shall use a section name that is unique for the Add-In, to avoid conflicts between Add-Ins. If the Add-In has a lot of options and you would like to group them into different sections, then use the same prefix for each section name. For example "CompanyABCAddIn.SectionA", "CompanyABCAddIn.SectionB" etc.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.ProjectSelection
member.summary: Represents a collection of all selected objects. Selection is a concept used from the user interface. Typically it is used to specify for which objects to perform an action, to view information for specific objects and to show which operations that are availble for specific objects. The most common way for a user to select an object is to click with the mouse in the graphic view or in a browser. Using this object you can programatically control which objects that are selected and get notified when selection has changed.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.Undo
member.summary: Undoes the operations made during the last undo step.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.Redo
member.summary: Redoes the changes undone by the last call to Undo()
member.remarks: It is not legal to call this method while inside an undo step.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.BeginUndoStep
member.summary: Starts a new unnamed undo step.
member.remarks: It is not recommended to make unnamed undo steps. Use BeginUndoStep(string name) instead.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.BeginUndoStep(System.String)
member.summary: Begins a new undo step.
member.param: The name of the undo step.
member.remarks: The name should be localized, since it will be displayed in the user interface.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.AppendToUndoStep(System.String)
member.summary: Similar to , but tries to append changes to the previous undo step, instead of creating a new one.
member.remarks: The name must match the name of the previous undo step. Otherwise a new undo step one will be created.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.AppendToUndoStep(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Similar to , but tries to append changes to the previous undo step, instead of creating a new one.
member.param: Name of undo step, if a new one is created.
If true, changes are appended to the previous undostep (if one exists) even if the names do not match.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.EndUndoStep
member.summary: Ends the current undo step.
member.remarks: It is legal to make nested calls to Begin/EndUndoStep(). Only the outermost EndUndoStep() call will actually close the undo step.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.CancelUndoStep(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.CancelUndoStepType)
member.summary: Marks the current undo step as canceled.
member.remarks: When the canceled undo step is closed by EndUndoStep(), either all changes will be undone ("rollback"), or the undo/redo queues will be cleared, depending on the value of 'cancelType'.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.ExecuteUndoStep(System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Creates an undo step and executes the code in the passed in delegate inside it.
member.remarks: In case of an exception, the undo step will be rolled back and the error will be logged to the RobotStudio output window.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded, false if an exception was thrown.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.ExecuteUndoStep(System.String,System.Action,System.Action{System.Exception})
member.summary: Creates an undo step and executes the code in the passed in delegate inside it.
member.remarks: In case of an exception, the passed in errorHandler delegate will be executed.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded, false if an exception was thrown.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.ExecuteAppendUndoStep(System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Creates or appends to an undo step and executes the code in the passed in delegate inside it.
member.remarks: The name must match the name of the previous undo step. Otherwise a new undo step one will be created. In case of an exception, the undo step will be rolled back and the error will be logged to the RobotStudio output window.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded, false if an exception was thrown.

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoDeltaState.Redo
member.summary: Redoes a previously undone delta state.
member.remarks:
Pre-condition: CanRedo() == true CanUndo() == false
Post-condition: CanRedo() == false CanUndo() == (true or false)

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoDeltaState.Undo
member.summary: Undoes a delta state.
member.remarks:
Pre-condition: CanRedo() == false CanUndo() == true
Post-condition: CanRedo() == (true or false) CanUndo() == false

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoDeltaState.Close
member.summary: Closes the delta state
member.remarks: No more changes should be added after this call. Will in turn call OnCloseDeltaState() in all changes.

member.summary: Reopens a closed deltastate so that more changes can be appended to it.

member.summary: Redoes a previously undone delta state

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.Undo
member.summary: Undoes the last delta state

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.BeginDeltaState(System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new delta state
member.remarks: It is legal to call this method when a delta state is already open. The number of calls to BeginDeltaState() and EndDeltaState() must match, however.

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.AppendDeltaState(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tries to "reopen" the last delta state, appending changes to it
member.remarks: If a description is not null, it must match the name of the previous deltastate, otherwise a new deltastate will be created. If there is no previous deltastate, a new one will be created (and aborted, so the queue will be empty after it has been closed)

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.EndDeltaState
member.summary: Ends the current delta state
member.remarks: There should be exacly the same number of calls to BeginDeltaState() and EndDeltaState().

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.AbortDeltaState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Aborts the current delta state
member.param: true if the queues should be cleared when the delta state is closed
member.remarks: This call just sets an abort flag; EndDeltaState() must still be called to actually close the delta state. After the delta state is closed, it will be rolled back(undone).
